casebody.data:
MABELLE RAWSON HIRONS v. JULIAN B. HUBBELL. Decided July 8th, 1897.

The cause was argued before Bond, O. J., Pattison, Urner, Adkins, Oeetjtt, Digges, Parke, and Sloan, JJ.

Edgar Allan Poe, with whom were Bartlett, Poe & Olaggett on the brief, for the appellant. Robert Peter, Jr., and Albert M. Bouic, for the appellee. Sloan, J.,

delivered the opinion of the Court, affirming the order dismissing the petition.
